Message: Okay, I understand you have a headache. To help me understand what might be causing it and how to best advise you, can you tell me, **where in your head do you feel the pain?**

Okay, you feel the headache in the front of your head.

To help me understand this better, **is the pain constant, or does it come and go?**

Okay, the headache in the front of your head is constant. 

To gather more information, **on a scale of 1 to 10, with 1 being very mild and 10 being the worst pain you can imagine, how would you rate your headache?**

Okay, so you have a constant headache in the front of your head, and you rate the pain as a 3 out of 10.

To get a better understanding of what might be happening, **have you experienced any sensitivity to light or sound along with the headache?**

Okay, so you have a constant headache in the front of your head, you rate the pain as a 3 out of 10, and you haven't experienced any sensitivity to light or sound.

Since you feel the pain in the front of your head and it is constant, it could possibly be a tension headache.

To help me narrow down the possibilities, **have you noticed any stiffness or soreness in your neck or shoulders?**

Okay, so you have a constant headache in the front of your head, you rate the pain as a 3 out of 10, you haven't experienced any sensitivity to light or sound, and you have not noticed any stiffness or soreness in your neck or shoulders.

Since you have a constant headache in the front of your head and have no sensitivity to light or sound, or stiffness and soreness in your neck or shoulders, it may still be a tension headache.

To help me better understand what you are experiencing, **have you taken any medication for the headache, and if so, did it help?**
